div.head: AN ANTIPHONE, or EPODE, For VV. D. his Heptachordon, TO THE AVTHOR.
div.l: THis seuen string'd Lute, as shewes the sacred Storie,
GOD made to shew the brightnesse of his Glorie.
On which, by diuerse Handes, sixe thousand Springs
Beene playde; and all to prayse that King of Kings.
Now last the Sonne of that sweet Swan-like Singer,
Who Christ in Armes embracing would not linger
Longer on Earth, harmoniouslie doth rayse
On it Notes fit the furious fits t'appease
Of Soules Saule-like, and of their franticke follie
Them charme, to sound his prayse who's only holie.
Therefore, my Brother deare, well mayst thou thinke
Employde thy Paines, thy Paper, Penne and Inke,
Whereby poore Soules are sav'd, Gods Name's extoll'd,
